snippet: The prosecution in the case against Oscar Pistorius, a double-amputee track star, planned to charge him with premeditated murder. A statement released by Pistorius’s agent said he disputed the murder charge.
abstract: Prosecution in case against Oscar Pistorius, double-amputee track star accused of fatally shooting his girlfriend Reeva Steemkamp, says that it plans to charge him with 'premeditated murder,' most serious murder charge under South African criminal law; Pistorius makes tearful appearance at courtroom in South African capital Pretoria.

byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from Paris, and Mukelwa Hlatshwayo from Pretoria, South Africa.

lead_paragraph: The prosecution in the case against Oscar Pistorius, a double-amputee track star, planned to charge him with premeditated murder. A statement released by Pistorius’s agent said he disputed the murder charge.

headline.seo: Pistorius Disputes Murder Charge After Hearing
headline.main: Tearful in Court, Pistorius Later Disputes Murder Charge
headline.print_headline: Tearful in Court, Pistorius Later Disputes Murder Charge
